document_title: Metapneumovirus pneumonia: Causes, signs and treatment
subsection_content:
Pneumonia caused by Metapneumovirus is an inflammatory condition of the lung parenchyma, including alveolitis, alveolar sacs, alveolar ducts, interstitial connective tissue and terminal bronchiolitis due to invasion and rapid spread. of Metapneumovirus.
Children under 5 years old, adults over 65 years old and people with weak immune systems are susceptible to Metapneumovirus pneumonia. When a child is infected, he or she can easily spread the disease to others in the family, school, playground, etc., thereby causing an outbreak in the community. Furthermore, when infected, the condition has a higher risk of complications. (first)
